player.contorller

Class ButtonSwitchController

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.contorller.ButtonSwitchController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ButtonSwitchController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Controller for buttons that handle the switch between frames.

    Introduction: It handles two type of buttons. One on the main screen which will direct the player to selected level screen. The other is on the level screen that allows the player to quit the level and go back to main screen.

    More detail: The quit button on the level screen have an additional function of storing the player's current score and depend wheter to unlock the next level.

    Author:
    zluo2

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Switch between main game window and level screen.

        Switch between two frams with button 15 level images and quit. It also writes the new highest score in a txt file.

        Specified by:
